As an AI language model, I can suggest some tips to make the turmeric face mask less messy to apply:

1. Wear old clothes or a towel around your neck to protect your clothes from the yellow staining effect of turmeric.

2. Apply the mask with a brush or spoon rather than using your fingers to avoid staining your nails and fingertips.

3. Keep a bowl and towel nearby to clean up any drips or spills.

4. Use warm water and a gentle cleanser to remove the mask, and be sure to rinse thoroughly to remove any excess turmeric.

5. If your skin is sensitive, you can add a few drops of olive oil to the turmeric and yogurt mixture to make it more moisturizing and easier to apply.

Remember to do a patch test to check for any adverse reactions before applying the mask to your entire face. Turmeric may stain your skin temporarily, but this effect can be reduced by applying a toner or moisturizer after removing the mask.
